title: Senate estimates has its Utopia moment
text:
Did they advise on the Inland Rail, the $10 billion project which is a major piece of national infrastructure?

"We haven't provided any advice on that," Chief executive Leilani Frew said.

"Why would you need another layer of advice on this?" Senator Gallacher said.

"If we are asked on that advice then we are happy to support government and the department," she replied.

The senators also wanted to know about their staffing arrangements.

Ms Frew, whose total remuneration for fiscal 2019 was $467,743, was asked about the structure of her staff, one of whom was sitting to her left – managing director William Brummitt, whose total remuneration is $282,431.

Labor senator Jenny McAllister observed that just under a third of the entire workforce at IPFA was in fact the leadership team.

"Is it a little top heavy?" Senator McAllister said, "It looks a bit top heavy to me."

Advertisement

To which Ms Frew replied: "As an executive agency, there is a corporate part of the business we need to maintain. The part that looks after our people and our finance. In terms of the rest of the business, it's advisory."

In the past year IPFA, which reports to the Minister for Population,

Cities and Urban Infrastructure, Alan Tudge, said it received 100 requests for commercial and financial advisory services.

Senator Gallacher further pursued what exactly IPFA was advising on right now.

"We have expertise on how you can bring private investment in to major infrastructure projects, on what terms and conditions that investment could be brought in on," Ms Frew said.

Senator Gallacher asked: "Do you charge for your services?"

"I wish!" Ms Frew replied.

It turns out the agency hasn't just been holding team building exercises and battling the photocopier as its ABC television alter ego does.

It has advised 11 government departments. All for free.
description: The government's key adviser on private investment in the controversial area of major infrastructure projects has faced a grilling on its staffing arrangements and the scope of its advice.
